title.rendered: John Dovich Recognized on Forbes’ Top Financial Security Professionals 2022 List

content.rendered:
August 2022 – MAI is thrilled to announce John Dovich, Regional President and head of MAI Insurance Solutions, LLC, has been recognized on Forbes’ Top Financial Security Professionals 2022 list. John is ranked third in Ohio.

Forbes ranks top insurance professionals across the industry and within each state on the annual list. This year’s list highlights individuals who Forbes notes are helping clients maintain focus on their long-term goals and preserve their wealth. To qualify, the financial services professionals must be licensed to sell life insurance and annuities and be nominated by their current firm. The ranking is based on quantitative data collected via survey, as well as interviews with finalists.

Our team is excited to recognize the honor for John and his work with our clients. We are dedicated to providing our clients with superior service and holistic offerings. We look forward to continuing to partner with you and your family and collectively work toward your goals.

Click Here to view this year’s Forbes’ Top Financial Security Professionals list.

On August 31, 2022, John Dovich ranked on Forbes Top Financial Security Professionals Best-In-State List for 2022. Information based on 12/31/2020-12/31/2021. In order to be considered for the Forbes Top Financial Security Professional Ranking, applicants must meet the following methodology requirements: The Forbes Top Financial Security Professional Ranking, developed by SHOOK Research, is based on an algorithm of qualitative criterion, mostly gained through telephone and in-person due diligence interviews, and quantitative data. Those advisors that are considered have a minimum of seven years’ experience, and the algorithm weighs factors like revenue trends, assets under management, compliance records, industry experience and those that encompass the highest standards of best practices. Portfolio performance is not a criterion due to varying client objectives and lack of audited data. Neither Forbes nor SHOOK receive a fee in exchange for rankings. (Source: Forbes.com)

In no case does MAI pay a fee to be considered for an award or to participate in rankings. Further, MAI is not required to be a subscriber to be included in their rankings or awards.

Third-party rankings and recognitions are no guarantee of future investment success and do not ensure that a client or prospective client will experience a higher level of performance results. These rankings should not be construed as an endorsement of the advisor by any client nor are they representative of any one client’s evaluation.

By clicking on the above link, you will leave MAI’s site and will be directed to a third-party site which MAI does not endorse and is not affiliated. Some third-party sites require registration or subscription to view content. Please see MAI’s disclosure page for more information.

Click Here for more information on the ranking methodology.

excerpt.rendered: There are a lot of reasons to hate volatile markets. They feel horrible to investors but, worse, they bring out emotions of fear and panic that can be detrimental to long-term capital appreciation. One dirty little secret is that investment advisors get scared too. The better ones don’t let these emotions rule their actions.
